page.title: 10LAMB'S HOUSE
page.content: Lamb's House is at the Shore in Leith.In 1561 Mary, Queen of Scots came over from France.She was waiting for the Lord Provost who must have been delayed by the fog. She was taken to a house of a merchant, called Andrew Lamb where she was given a glass of wine and something to eat. After that she went to Holyrood Palace Now Lamb's House is for retired people. There is a games room where they can play snooker, darts,dominoes and scrabble. There is also an art and craft room, keep fit, drama and dancing rooms. On some days the chiropodist and the hair dresser come. The old people enjoy each other's company. They also enjoy the food and the activities, like drama and snooker. But the most important thing is the company.
